response:
Urgent imaging is paramount to visualise the lesions and distinguish between demyelination, ischaemia, and abscesses. Given the high CRP, a septic screen and cardiac imaging are critical to rule out infection before considering immunosuppression. Specific antibody testing will help differentiate between MS and other neuro-inflammatory conditions.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Spine with contrast", "Full blood count", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood cultures", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ANCA, ENA)", "Serum ACE", "Aquaporin-4 and MOG antibodies", "HIV and Syphilis serology", "Transthoracic Echocardiogram", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF analysis, culture, oligoclonal bands)", "Optical Coherence Tomography"]
